meanings.definition: A strong coffee made by forcing steam through ground coffee beans.
meanings.sent1: I ordered an expresso to wake me up in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The cafe served delicious expresso to its customers.
meanings.sent3: The expresso was so strong, it practically jumped out of the cup!
meanings.sent4: Her energy was like an expresso shot, fueling her through the day.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the expresso filled the room, enticing everyone to take a sip.

meanings.definition: To convey or communicate a thought or feeling.
meanings.sent1: She tried to expresso her gratitude through a heartfelt thank you.
meanings.sent2: He used art to expresso his emotions when words failed him.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to expresso his jokes, but the audience didn't quite get it.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes expressoed a mix of surprise and joy when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: Music has the power to expresso emotions that words cannot describe.
